meanings.definition: To write or print in capital letters.
meanings.sent1: I ALWAYS UPPERCASED MY NAME ON THE FORMS.
meanings.sent2: Please make sure to UPPERCASE the first letter of each sentence.
meanings.sent3: The teacher UPPERCASED the entire paragraph by mistake, making it look like a SHOUT.
meanings.sent4: His anger was so intense, it felt like he was UPPERCASING every word he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The sign was so clear because it was UPPERCASED in bold red letters.

meanings.definition: Written or printed in capital letters.
meanings.sent1: The TITLE ON THE BOOK WAS UPPERCASED and easy to read.
meanings.sent2: She preferred her notes to be UPPERCASED for better visibility.
meanings.sent3: The UPPERCASED words on the menu made the dishes seem more important.
meanings.sent4: The UPPERCASED letters on the signboard stood out against the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The UPPERCASED text on the poster caught everyone's attention immediately.
